The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Dear Parents,
Please find this weeks edition of our Weekly News!!!
Find below some interesting information and dates to mark down in your agendas.
Parent Teacher Consultations - Foundation Stage
Foundation Stage PTCs will take place on Thursday 11th and Thursday 18th October from 4-6pm. Please ensure that you have completed the form and returned them to school as soon as possible to secure an appointment. We look forward to greeting you on those evenings.
Class Representatives - Thank You!
We are pleased to announce a final list of class reps for this year. Please see below. We will have our initial welcome meeting next week. Maaike will be confirming the time, venue and agenda with reps ASAP.
Please click here for class rep list.
New School Website
Our new school website is now live! Please do find the time to visit it and enjoy the new design and features. Please understand that we are aware that the staff directory needs to be completed and that more photographs of our school do need to be added. We will be addressing these small issues in the near future. Please enjoy and do let us know if you have any feedback.
LC access
We are kindly asking you to avoid making a U-turn at the barrier ("shlagbaum"). This creates inconveniences for other vehicles and contributes towards the traffic issues near LC. We would appreciate if you could share this information with your drivers as well.
After School Activity programme
Here at International School of Moscow we have a varied and inclusive After School Activity programme. We are also aware that, as parents, you can also offer a lot in the way of experience and contacts.
If there are any parents that feel they can help us to enrich our ASA programme further in term two and three by leading and assisting an activity, or by providing contacts for facilities and coaches, then please contact us here in the PE department.
After school activities will run every Tuesday and Wednesday, 3.25pm to 4.25pm from 29th January and will require any volunteers or coaches to commit to every week. A limited number of ASA’s can incur a cost if the leader of the activity wishes to charge.
Position at the British Embassy
The British Embassy is looking for a Medical Practitioner to join a small team at the Embassy’s Medical Centre on a part-time basis. This position is open to nationals of the United Kingdom, United States of America, EU countries and some Commonwealth countries.
More information on the job description and how to apply can be found at:
http://ukinrussia.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/our-embassy/working-for-us/medical-practitioner
Best regards,
The International School of Moscow World Class Education
